recipe1.name: Banana Cake
preparation_steps: Step 1: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan.
Step 2: In a medium bowl, mash the ripe bananas until smooth. Set aside.
Step 3: In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Step 4: Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
Step 5: In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Step 6: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk. Begin and end with the flour mixture.
Step 7: Fold in the mashed bananas until well incorporated.
Step 8: Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan, spreading it out evenly.
Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Step 10: Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Step 11: Optionally, frost with your favorite icing or dust with powdered sugar before serving.

recipe2.name: Orange Soup
preparation_steps: Step 1: Peel and chop the carrots, sweet potatoes, and onions.
Step 2: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onions and garlic, and sauté until fragrant.
Step 3: Add the chopped carrots and sweet potatoes to the pot and sauté for another 5 minutes.
Step 4: Pour in the vegetable broth, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Step 5: Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Step 6: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

recipe3.name: Pasta with Cornflower and Crème
preparation_steps: Step 1: Cook the pasta according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Step 2: In a small bowl, mix the cornflower with a little bit of water to form a smooth paste.
Step 3: In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Step 4: Add the heavy cream to the saucepan and bring to a gentle simmer.
Step 5: Stir in the cornflower paste, and cook for a few minutes until the sauce thickens.
Step 6: Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and toss to coat evenly.
Step 7: Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese until melted and well combined.
Step 8: Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
